page.title: 04Castle Hill
page.content: Castle Hill has been lived in by many generations of the Fortescue family. In 1719 Hugh Fortescue succeeded his father. He did not think the dwelling of his ancestors was suitable so he built a house named Castle Hill Mansion. William Kent was employed to change the landscape around Castle Hill. Looking from the temple on the top of Castle Hill there is a very good view over Bideford Bay. Coming down the hill to the stream there is Sybils Cave. The house was built near three streams. One was part of the River Bray and the others were running from east to west, and north to south. The biggest is the River Bray with brown trout and at one time salmon.
